issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.58 (foreground color: #999999, background color: #f4f4f2, font size: 9.0pt (12px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

nodes.html: Posted on May 28, 2019 by Jessica Smith
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.58 (foreground color: #999999, background color: #f4f4f2, font size: 9.0pt (12px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.59:1. Recommendation:  change text colour to #242424.

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.59:1. Recommendation:  change text colour to #242424.
original_issue.selector: html > body > main > div > div > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(2) > p:nth-child(2)

issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.14:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #cc0000, surrounding text: #333333)
The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.14:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #cc0000, surrounding text: #333333)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > main > div > aside > div > input

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.selector: html > body > main > div > aside > div > input

automatic.name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (81px by 17px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 22px instead of at least 24px.
